sentence.Network_en: The New York Times has this very laudatory article about your retirement.
sentence.Network_cn: 《纽约时报》发文谈及你的隐退，文中对你大加赞扬。

sentence.Network_en: Beth spoke of Dr. Hammer in laudatory terms.
sentence.Network_cn: 贝丝谈及哈默医生时赞不绝口。

sentence.Network_en: Now , when Carrie heard Drouet's laudatory opinion of her dramatic ability, her body tingled with satisfaction.
sentence.Network_cn: 听到杜洛埃这么称道自己的演戏才能, 她心满意足精神振奋.

(愉悦的)、laudatory (褒扬的)、hopeful(有希望的)、critical (批评的)、doubtful(怀疑的)、positive(肯定的)、 negative (否定的)、sensational (耸人听闻的).

list.abs: DIATRIBE恶骂，酷评n.laudatory piece of writing赞扬性的文章HOODWINK欺瞒，蒙蔽v.
【反】laudatory speech(赞扬的演说);laudatory words(赞美之词);flatter(vt 过分夸赞;奉承);" "inveigh",v 猛烈抨击(以发泄怒气);辱骂 【记】in进入,veigh.
a laudatory speech ., 赞美性发言.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from late Latin laudatorius, from laudat- 'praised', from the verb laudare (see laud)

entry.tran: （文章或言谈）表示赞美的，颂扬性的
entry.def: A laudatory piece of writing or speech expresses praise or admiration for someone.

example.ex: The New York Times has this very laudatory article about your retirement...
example.tran: 《纽约时报》发文谈及你的隐退，文中对你大加赞扬。

example.ex: Beth spoke of Dr. Hammer in laudatory terms.
example.tran: 贝丝谈及哈默医生时赞不绝口。
